ygData.subject: Re: Question about Kelin's Lugubrious Lement
ygData.msgSnippet: You don t attack the one you lament... you lament all the ones you want to stay behind and then attack the single one you want to engage.  When you do lament
ygData.messageBody:
You don't attack the one you lament... you lament all the ones you
want to stay behind and then attack the single one you want to
engage. When you do lament them, I strongly suggest using you do so
with your lute/mandolin in hand, since without it, the lament doesn't
last very long and you risk having the ones you lamented still chase
you.

Tigsen

--- CyberGhozt _ <cyberghozt@...> wrote:
> From: CyberGhozt _ <cyberghozt@...>
>
> I know that this song has been talked about a whole lot...but sadly
> i missed
> all of it. All I want to know is how you can take out a whole camp
> using it?
> I tried this but it did not seem to work. I fought the orcs in east
>
> commonlands in their camps for quite a while. If i used the song on
> one and
> then attacked it, when it left camp, the rest of the orcs followed.
> Can
> somebody just explain all the uses of it?
> Thanks...
>
